title: Partisan
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Partisan/zh-CN "Partisan/zh-CN")

| ) [![Partisan.png](/images/c/c1/Partisan.png)](/wiki/File:Partisan.png) |                                                         |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                    | partisan                                                |
| Appearance                                                              | vulgar polearm                                          |
| Damage vs. small                                                        | d6                                                      |
| Damage vs. large                                                        | d6+1                                                    |
| To-hit bonus                                                            | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill                                                            | [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm")                      |
| Size                                                                    | [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed")             |
| Base price                                                              | 10 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                  | [80](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                                | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                               |

A **partisan** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") that is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **vulgar polearm** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [5.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [5.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.6 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and antique weapons outlets can sell partisans.

[Watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") and [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") may [be generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a partisan.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") have an effective 1⁄8 chance of being generated with a partisan.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Strategy

The partisan has the lowest average damage against small monsters of all polearms, being tied with the [fauchard](/wiki/Fauchard "Fauchard") and [glaive](/wiki/Glaive "Glaive"). Its average damage against large monsters is also lacking among polearms: the fauchard is somewhat lighter in [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") for roughly the same damage, while the glaive is only slightly less heavy, but deals better damage versus large monsters.

## History

The partisan is introduced with all other polearms in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Partisan (weapon)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Partisan_\(weapon\) "wikipedia:Partisan (weapon)")***

[![Partisans.png](/images/thumb/9/92/Partisans.png/300px-Partisans.png)](/wiki/File:Partisans.png)



A partisan, also known as a partizan, is a type of polearm that was used in Europe during the 16th to 18th centuries, and consisted of a spearhead with small pronged protrusions mounted on a long wooden shaft. The partisan was often used by infantry soldiers to fend off cavalry charges, with the protrusions used to catch, parry and/or trap an opponent's sword and disarm them. In profile, the spearhead of a partisan may look similar to other types of polearm, such as the halberd, ranseur, or spetum: among the partisan's distinguishing features are its spearhead being more likely to have a flat bladed tip, and its generally broader "prongs" having the single edge facing out.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Yeomen](/wiki/Yeomen "Yeomen") start each game with a [+1](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") partisan.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), [Ramiel](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Ramiel "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") partisan that has +1d4 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals +1 [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock") damage against monsters without [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"). Pounding with Ramiel causes 3x3 shocking explosions centered on the target monster that deal 6d6 damage, while attacking a monster with Ramiel in melee when [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") fires a 6d6 ray of [lightning](/wiki/Lightning "Lightning") in the direction of that monster.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), the partisan is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the partisan is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a partisan can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword") and a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"). This also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [troll](/wiki/Troll_\(starting_race\) "Troll (starting race)") characters that are not [Convicts](/wiki/Convict "Convict") have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a partisan as their starting polearm.

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for polearm](/wiki/Polearm#Encyclopedia_entry "Polearm").*

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 194](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L194)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 445](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L445)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Partisan

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
)
Name partisan
Appearance vulgar polearm
Damage vs. small d6
Damage vs. large d6+1
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill polearm
Size two-handed
Base price 10 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 80
Material iron

A partisan is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. It is a two-handed polearm that is made of iron, and appears as a vulgar polearm when unidentified.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 dNetHack
    • 5.3 NetHack Fourk
    • 5.4 xNetHack
    • 5.5 EvilHack
    • 5.6 SlashTHEM
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry
  • 7 References

Generation

In addition to random generation, general shops and antique weapons outlets can sell partisans.

Watchmen and soldiers may be generated with a partisan.[1] Trolls have an effective 1⁄8 chance of being generated with a partisan.[2]

Strategy

The partisan has the lowest average damage against small monsters of all polearms, being tied with the fauchard and glaive. Its average damage against large monsters is also lacking among polearms: the fauchard is somewhat lighter in weight for roughly the same damage, while the glaive is only slightly less heavy, but deals better damage versus large monsters.

History

The partisan is introduced with all other polearms in NetHack 1.3d.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Partisan (weapon)

A partisan, also known as a partizan, is a type of polearm that was used in Europe during the 16th to 18th centuries, and consisted of a spearhead with small pronged protrusions mounted on a long wooden shaft. The partisan was often used by infantry soldiers to fend off cavalry charges, with the protrusions used to catch, parry and/or trap an opponent's sword and disarm them. In profile, the spearhead of a partisan may look similar to other types of polearm, such as the halberd, ranseur, or spetum: among the partisan's distinguishing features are its spearhead being more likely to have a flat bladed tip, and its generally broader "prongs" having the single edge facing out.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, Yeomen start each game with a +1 partisan.

dNetHack

In dNetHack and notdNetHack, Ramiel is a lawful artifact partisan that has +1d4 to-hit and deals +1 shock damage against monsters without shock resistance. Pounding with Ramiel causes 3x3 shocking explosions centered on the target monster that deal 6d6 damage, while attacking a monster with Ramiel in melee when riding fires a 6d6 ray of lightning in the direction of that monster.

NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, the partisan is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the partisan is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, a partisan can be created at a forge by combining a broadsword and a spear. This also applies to Hack'EM.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, troll characters that are not Convicts have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with a partisan as their starting polearm.

Encyclopedia entry

See the encyclopedia entry for polearm.

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 194
  2. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 445

A '''partisan''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[two-handed]] [[polearm]] that is made of [[iron]], and appears as a '''vulgar polearm''' when [[Identification|unidentified]].

==Generation==
In addition to random generation, general [[shop]]s and antique weapons outlets can sell partisans.

[[Watchmen]] and [[soldier]]s may [[Monster starting inventory|be generated with]] a partisan.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|194|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[Troll (monster class)|Trolls]] have an effective {{frac|8}} chance of being generated with a partisan.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|445|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Strategy==
The partisan has the lowest average damage against small monsters of all polearms, being tied with the [[fauchard]] and [[glaive]]. Its average damage against large monsters is also lacking among polearms: the fauchard is somewhat lighter in [[weight]] for roughly the same damage, while the glaive is only slightly less heavy, but deals better damage versus large monsters.

==History==
The partisan is introduced with all other polearms in [[NetHack 1.3d]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Partisan (weapon)}}
[[Image:Partisans.png|thumb|right]]
A partisan, also known as a partizan, is a type of polearm that was used in Europe during the 16th to 18th centuries, and consisted of a spearhead with small pronged protrusions mounted on a long wooden shaft. The partisan was often used by infantry soldiers to fend off cavalry charges, with the protrusions used to catch, parry and/or trap an opponent's sword and disarm them. In profile, the spearhead of a partisan may look similar to other types of polearm, such as the halberd, ranseur, or spetum: among the partisan's distinguishing features are its spearhead being more likely to have a flat bladed tip, and its generally broader "prongs" having the single edge facing out.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[Yeomen]] start each game with a [[Enchantment|+1]] partisan.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], [[dNetHack artifacts#Ramiel|Ramiel]] is a lawful [[artifact]] partisan that has +1d4 [[to-hit]] and deals +1 [[shock]] damage against monsters without [[shock resistance]]. Pounding with Ramiel causes 3x3 shocking explosions centered on the target monster that deal 6d6 damage, while attacking a monster with Ramiel in melee when [[riding]] fires a 6d6 ray of [[lightning]] in the direction of that monster.

===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], the partisan is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the partisan is one of the few polearms that is not removed.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], a partisan can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[broadsword]] and a [[spear]]. This also applies to [[Hack'EM]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, [[Troll (starting race)|troll]] characters that are not [[Convict]]s have a {{frac|4}} chance of generating with a partisan as their starting polearm.
